com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface copyOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface copyOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document copyOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The copyOrder API duplicates an existing order to create a new order.

    • Method Detail

      • copyOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document copyOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                               org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                               java.rmi.RemoteException

        The copyOrder API duplicates an existing order to create a new order. If data modification is required, the new data can be specified in the input XML. New data cannot be passed for list elements like OrderLines, KitLines, Instructions etc. API appends information for list elements with source order. For example if you pass input xml as follows to override shipnode API will try to add the line to order.
        <Order>
        <OrderLines>
        <OrderLine PrimeLineNo="1" SubLineNo="1" OrderedQty= "1" ShipNode="N1"/>
        </OrderLines></Order>

        Note: Any OrderLine element which does not have OrderedQty attribute is ignored by the API.

        This API performs all related database updates, such as inventory updates.

        The order that is duplicated, is referred to as the source order in this document.

        The CopyOrderTemplate is stored in YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE. This template is used to retrieve data from the source order. The root node of CopyOrderTemplate must be Order. In this template, the PaymentMethod element must not have the child element ChargeTransactionDetails. If CopyOrderTemplate allows OrderLineOption and its CustomAttributes, they are copied from existing order to new order.

        Entitlement Rules

        An order gets created only if the customer on the order or the calling organization are entitled to all the items listed in the order. The entitlement rules are applied as follows:

        • Customer Entitlements: Customer entitlement rules get applied when ValidateItem flag is set to true on order line. The rules are applied based on Item Entitlement Strategy rule set by the customer's enterprise organization. The values of this rule are interpreted as follows:
          • 01 - Item entitlement logic is enforced based only on the item entitlement rules assigned to the customer.
          • 02 - Item entitlement logic is enforced based only on the pricelists assigned to the customer.
          • 03 - Item entitlement logic is enforced based on the intersection of item entitlement rules and pricelists assigned to the customer. This indicates that only the entitled items with valid price assigned will be presented to the customers.
          • 04 - Item entitlement logic is ignored.
        • Selling Entitlements: Selling entitlement rules get applied when the calling organization is not a catalog organization. These rules are applied regardless of what entitlement strategy is selected

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSVerifyOrderUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSBeforeCreateOrderUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDeliveryLeadTimeUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDistanceUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPDetermineBestMultiStopTransferUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOrderNoUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSConvertCurrencyUE
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateHeaderTaxUE
            This user exit is called if element HeaderTax is not passed.

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE
            This user exit is called if the element LineTax is not passed.

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSDetermineDateForPricingUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE

        Events Raised:
        All events raised by the createOrder API are raised for the newly created order under the user-specifed transaction or the ORDER_CREATE transaction.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions:
        The source order and the CopyOrderTemplate must exist in the system.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to the output XML for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Yes, except for tables that are not extensible. Refer to the ERD for more details.

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatability: No

        Additional Information:
        If the source order does not exist in the database, the "YFS10242 - YFS:No Order is found for Processing" error is thrown.
        If the CopyOrderTemplate does not exist in the database, the "YFS10379 - Template not found" error is thrown.
        All the validations and defaulting rules performed by the createOrder API are applicable to the copyOrder API. See createOrder for more details.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the newly created order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
